document.title: Blizzard se la joue nostalgique en remontrant des visuels des premières versions de WoW
document.author: Fabio
document.text:
Blizzard aime bien (et nous aussi) montrer (et remontrer) les protos de ses jeux ( ici Hearthstone ) comme nous on aime mettre plein de parenthèses dans nos articles (assurément).
Premier visuel pris de WoW nourri par le moteur de Warcraft III
Dave Wilson, qui est Recruitment marketing , a tweeté bon nombre de visuels tirés de vieilles versions du célèbre MMORPG (Notre cher Pierre , Docteur ès WoW , nous fait dire que certains de ces visuels ont déjà été vus auparavant). Ça reste l’occasion de s’apercevoir du chemin parcouru par World of Warcraft ces 15 dernières années. Proto-Outland. « Originally Outland was to be a zone that shipped with the original World of Warcraft. » #WoWHistory pic.twitter.com/9scKeMEKAX — Dave Wilson (@gopherstick) June 7, 2015
« An early development model of C’Thun, the final boss in the Temple of Ahn’Qiraj. » #WoWHistory pic.twitter.com/QZeyOUY2wq — Dave Wilson (@gopherstick) June 7, 2015
« The Ruins of Lordaeron. » #WoWHistory pic.twitter.com/daueoCcVF4 — Dave Wilson (@gopherstick) June 7, 2015
« why are the mobs attacking the boss? » The first test (and wipe) of Blackwing Lair. #WoWHistory pic.twitter.com/tbKtSlz9vD — Dave Wilson (@gopherstick) June 7, 2015
The very first Molten Core raid. « Scott Mercer and Jeff Kaplan saved the zone by making it in a week.” #WoWHistory pic.twitter.com/nveAynAWFk — Dave Wilson (@gopherstick) June 7, 2015
« An early design map of Kalimdor. Zones are shown in red and dungeons in yellow. » #WoWHistory pic.twitter.com/nGMvMNQyZK — Dave Wilson (@gopherstick) June 7, 2015
« That’s a big arrow. » The first test fight against Onyxia. #WoWHistory pic.twitter.com/tobfNvwqwJ — Dave Wilson (@gopherstick) June 7, 2015
« [Once] « Atari Map » was completed for Arathi Basin, Jim Chadwick began laying out the level in WoW edit. » #WoWHistory pic.twitter.com/WE3icmiosF — Dave Wilson (@gopherstick) June 7, 2015
« Originally the Juggernaut in the Deadmines was built outside. » #WoWHistory pic.twitter.com/7oW15p7XYM — Dave Wilson (@gopherstick) June 7, 2015
The first flight point test. Alliance character rides on the Wyvern as Gryphons weren’t yet animated. #WoWHistory pic.twitter.com/0TVO5COImu — Dave Wilson (@gopherstick) June 7, 2015
« Early versions of the female troll model. » #WoWHistory pic.twitter.com/8kh4QEA11A — Dave Wilson (@gopherstick) June 7, 2015
« The first character select screen built by Aaron Keller. Originally World of Warcraft had only 6 races. » #WoWHistory pic.twitter.com/Dc3swmI47p — Dave Wilson (@gopherstick) June 7, 2015
« This shot shows some undead designs whose identity fluctuated throughout early development. » Circa 2000. #WoWHistory pic.twitter.com/9d33E3lA0G — Dave Wilson (@gopherstick) June 7, 2015
Placeholder town of Valguard circa 1999. Coming soon™ no doubt. Let’s see a Malbourn cosplay at BlizzCon! #WoWHistory pic.twitter.com/hKnPmWU6M0 — Dave Wilson (@gopherstick) June 7, 2015
Est-ce que vous vous souvenez de vos premiers pas en Azeroth ?
